rationale: HPI includes all key subjective items: improved breathing, concern about long-term steroid effects, jitteriness from inhaler, and notes that only “a few doses” remain; however, it omits a precise day count.
Med list names prednisone (short course, few doses left), confirms tiotropium correct use and adherence, and states no other inhalers; lacks exact course length or dosing details.
Plan advises finishing short course and to report worsening jitteriness, but gives minimal risk–benefit counseling and does not discuss broader steroid side effects.
Management continues tiotropium and completes prednisone without extension, consistent with guidelines; omits explicit follow-up arrangement.
Note is concise with little duplication and no irrelevant copy-pasted material aside from minor repetition of visit reason.
